intro: Erysimum simplex, commonly known as the common wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and somewhat succulent. Erysimum simplex is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
